choices.C: An inbound rule for TCP port 1723
choices.F: An outbound rule for TCP port 1701
choices.E: An outbound rule for TCP port 1723
choices.D: an inbound rule for TCP port 21
choices.A: an inbound rule for TCP port 20

discussion.content: port 21 is for client connecting to servers and port 20 is for servers connecting to clients

A and C is wrong. 
1723 is for PPTP service.
so, A is good
Why port 1723 ?? Port 1723 for VPN PPTP but in question don't ask PPTP

questions.question_text:
You install Windows Server 2012 R2 on a standalone server named Server1. You configure Server1 as an FTP server.
You need to ensure that client computers can establish FTP connections to Server1 and that Server1 can establish FTP connections to other servers.
Which two firewall rules should you create? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
